metadata.dcterms:title: Replication Data for: Native bee communities vary across three prairie ecoregions due to land use, climate, sampling method and bee life history traits
metadata.dcterms:creator: Kohler, Monica
Sturm, Ashton
Sheffield, Cory S.
Carlyle, Cameron N.
Manson, Jessamyn S.
metadata.dcterms:description: Data associated with a study investigating the effects of landuse on wild bee communities in Alberta, Canada. Files contain data on study locations and records for all bee specimens, as well as a file describing the data.
metadata.dcterms:subject: Agricultural Sciences
Earth and Environmental Sciences
cropland
rangeland
canola
grazing
pollinators
grassland
metadata.dcterms:isReferencedBy: Kohler M, Sturm A, Sheffield CS, Carlyle CN, Manson JS. 2020. Native bee communities vary across three prairie ecoregions due to land use, climate, sampling method and bee life history traits. Insect Conservation and Diversity., doi
